response.overview: According to doctors, hundreds of patients in Dutch hospitals may die every year due to failing software. Investigative journalist Wilfried Koomen investigated Dutch hospital care and made shocking discoveries. Why don't software vendors take reports of deaths seriously? Dutch healthcare costs taxpayers more than 100 billion euros per year. Much of the money for patient care ends up in the pockets of rich and powerful companies. The government is standing by and watching. This is the result if healthcare is left to the market.
response.tagline: According to doctors, hundreds of patients in Dutch hospitals may die every year due to failing software. Investigative journalist Wilfried Koomen made shocking discoveries.
response.title: Dodelijke Zorg
